coexistence_simulator.radar.signal_processing.doppler_fft

Slow‑time Doppler FFT helper.

The function treats the first dimension of a pulse stack as slow time and computes a Doppler spectrum for each range bin. It returns both the complex spectrum and an aligned frequency axis.

Assumptions

  • The pulse‑repetition frequency (PRF) is uniform.

  • Windowing is optional and defaults to a Hann window.

  • Zero‑padding to the next power of two can be enabled.

Example

```python import numpy as np from coexistence_simulator.radar.signal_processing.doppler_fft import (

doppler_fft,

)

pulses = np.random.randn(128, 256) + 1j * np.random.randn(128, 256) spec, f_hz = doppler_fft(pulses, prf=1e3) ```

Functions

doppler_fft(pulses, prf[, window, pad_pow2])

Compute the Doppler FFT along the slow‑time axis.
